enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: To provide additional visas for the Afghan Special Immigrant Visa Program, and for other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 602(b)(3) of the Afghan Allies Protection Act of 2009

header.#text: Extension of Afghan special immigrant program

text.#text: the period during which an alien must have been employed in accordance with paragraph (2)(A)(ii) must terminate on or before December 31, 2014;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in accordance with paragraph (2)(D) not later than December 31, 2014; and

text.#text: the principal alien seeking special immigrant status under this subparagraph shall apply to the
the authority to provide such status shall terminate on December 31, 2014.

During the period beginning on the date of the enactment of this subparagraph and ending on December 31, 2014, an additional 1,000 principal aliens may be provided special immigrant status under this section. For purposes of status provided under this subparagraph—
Clause (i) shall not be construed to affect the authority, numerical limitations, or terms for provision of status, under subparagraph (D).

header.#text: Special rule for end of calendar year 2014
Temporary fee increase for certain consular services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , not later than January 1, 2015, shall increase the fee or surcharge authorized under

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: by $1.00 for processing machine-readable nonimmigrant visas and machine-readable combined border crossing identification cards and nonimmigrant visas.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 140(a) of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995/s:140/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the additional amount collected pursuant the fee increase authorized under subsection (a) shall be deposited in the general fund of the Treasury.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 140(a)(2) of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995/s:140/ss:a/p:2

text.#text: The fee increase authorized under subsection (a) shall terminate on the date that is 5.5 years after the first date on which such increased fee is collected.
